content: The category of Sets, which would be of type Cat or of type Category (Type.{u}), is a pretty simple thing to make. But I was hoping there would be a standard one already. Is that the case?
Sure, just treat Type as a category. There is an instance of Category Type that will be picked up automatically
Wait, what if I wanted a functor F : Functor ğ•Šğ•–ğ•¥ ğ•Šğ•–ğ•¥. In that case, I would want to be able to name ğ•Šğ•–ğ•¥ : Category Type.{u}.

Just write F : Functor Type Type (or Functor (Type u) (Type v))
mathlib4 docs doesn't show the notation but you can write F : Type â¥¤ Type too.
